standard_metadata.standard_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Divide whole numbers to get a decimal

hints.content: $\begin{array}{rr} &\phantom{0}\phantom{000}&\\ 20&\overline{\Big)4}\phantom{000} \end{array}$
$\begin{array}{rr} &\phantom{0}\phantom{000}&\\ 20&\overline{\Big)\blue4}\phantom{000} \end{array}$  How many times does $20$ go into $\blue{4}$?
$\begin{array}{rr} &\pink0\phantom{.00}&\\ 20&\overline{\Big)4}\phantom{00} \end{array}$
$\begin{array}{rr}  &0.\phantom{0}&\\ 20&\overline{\Big)4\phantom{.}\blue{0}} \end{array}$  Write in a decimal and a zero.
$\begin{array}{rr}  &0.\phantom{0}&\\ 20&\overline{\Big)\blue{4}\phantom{.}\blue0} \\ \end{array}$  How many times does $20$ go into $\blue{40}$?

$\begin{array}{rr} &0.\pink{2}&\\ 20&\overline{\Big)\blue{4\phantom{.}0}}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{{4\phantom{.}0}}\\ &\orange{0} \end{array}$  $20$ goes into $\blue{40}$ exactly $\pink{2}$ times, so we write $\pink{2}$ in the quotient.
$\begin{array}{rr} &0.\pink{2}&\\ 20&\overline{\Big)\blue{4\phantom{.}0}}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{{4\phantom{.}0}}\\ &\orange{0} \end{array}$  The remainder is $\orange{0}$ so we have our answer.
